### About this site

```{r}
# loading the necessary packages

library(tidyverse)
library(plotly)
library(sf)
library(tmap)
library(tmaptools)
library(shinyjs)
library(cowplot)
```

# Tree Health

```{r}
# importing the data

trees_2015 =
  read_csv("large_tree_data/2015_tree_raw.csv", na = c("", "NA", "Unknown")) |> 
  janitor::clean_names()
```

```{r}
# reading in the nyc shapefile 

zip_nyc <- st_read("small_data/MODZCTA_2010.shp")

str(zip_nyc)
glimpse(zip_nyc)
head(zip_nyc)

tm_shape(zip_nyc) +
  tm_polygons()
```

```{r}
# joining the trees data with sf object
trees_zip <- 
  merge(zip_nyc, trees_2015, 
                        by.x = "MODZCTA",
                        by.y = "postcode") |> 
  janitor::clean_names()
```

```{r}
# getting borough names

trees_zip |> 
  pull(borough) |> 
  unique()

trees_zip |> 
  pull(nta_name) |> 
  unique()
```

```{r}
# map of tree health in Manhattan

trees_zip |> 
  drop_na() |> 
  filter(borough == "Manhattan",
         status == "Alive") |>
  tm_shape() +   
  tm_polygons(col = "health",
              style = "equal",
              n = 3,
              palette = "viridis",
              border.col = "black",
              title = "Tree Heath by Zip Codes in Manhattan")
```

```{r}
# interactive map based on tree health in Washington Heights

trees_2015 |>
  drop_na() |> 
  filter(borough == "Manhattan",
         status == "Alive",
         nta_name == c("Washington Heights South", "Washington Heights North")) |>
   plot_ly(
       x = ~longitude, y = ~latitude, color = ~health, text = ~spc_common,
       type = "scatter", mode = "markers", alpha = 0.5)
```
